org.fishwife.jrugged.spring

Class CircuitBreakerBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
      • org.fishwife.jrugged.spring.CircuitBreakerBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MonitoredService, ServiceWrapper, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

    @ManagedResource
public class CircuitBreakerBean
extends CircuitBreaker
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
    This is basically a CircuitBreaker that adds JMX annotations to some of the methods so that the core library doesn't have to depend on spring-context.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker

        CircuitBreaker.BreakerState

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircuitBreakerBean()
      Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreakerBean(FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreakerBean(String name)
      Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreakerBean(String name, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
      CircuitBreakerBean(String name, FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreakerBean(String name, FailureInterpreter fi, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean()
        Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean(String name)
        Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the CircuitBreakerBean

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean(FailureInterpreter fi)
        Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean(String name,
                          FailureInterpreter fi)
        Creates a CircuitBreakerBean with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the CircuitBreakerBean
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean(String name,
                          CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
        Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the CircuitBreakerBean
        mapper - helper used to translate a CircuitBreakerException into an application-specific one

      • CircuitBreakerBean

        public CircuitBreakerBean(String name,
                          FailureInterpreter fi,
                          CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
        Creates a CircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the CircuitBreakerBean
        fi - the FailureInterpreter to use when determining whether a specific failure ought to cause the breaker to trip
        mapper - helper used to translate a CircuitBreakerException into an application-specific one

      • setByPassState

        @ManagedAttribute
public void setByPassState(boolean b)
        When called with true - causes the CircuitBreaker to byPass its functionality allowing requests to be executed unmolested until the CircuitBreaker is reset or the byPass is manually set to false.
        Overrides:
        setByPassState in class CircuitBreaker

      • getByPassState

        @ManagedAttribute
public boolean getByPassState()
        Get the current state of the CircuitBreaker byPass
        Overrides:
        getByPassState in class CircuitBreaker
        Returns:
        boolean the byPass flag's current value

      • reset

        @ManagedOperation
public void reset()
        Manually set the breaker to be reset and ready for use. This is only useful after a manual trip otherwise the breaker will trip automatically again if the service is still unavailable. Just like a real breaker. WOOT!!!
        Overrides:
        reset in class CircuitBreaker

      • getResetMillis

        @ManagedAttribute
public long getResetMillis()
        Returns the cooldown period in milliseconds.
        Overrides:
        getResetMillis in class CircuitBreaker
        Returns:
        long

      • setResetMillis

        @ManagedAttribute
public void setResetMillis(long l)
        Sets the reset period to the given number of milliseconds. The default is 15,000 (make one retry attempt every 15 seconds).
        Overrides:
        setResetMillis in class CircuitBreaker
        Parameters:
        l - number of milliseconds to "cool down" after tripping before allowing a "test request" through again

      • getHealthCheck

        @ManagedAttribute
public String getHealthCheck()
        Returns a String representation of the breaker's status; potentially useful for exposing to monitoring software.
        Overrides:
        getHealthCheck in class CircuitBreaker
        Returns:
        String which is "GREEN" if the breaker is CLOSED; "YELLOW" if the breaker is HALF_CLOSED; and "RED" if the breaker is OPEN (tripped).

      • getLimit

        @ManagedAttribute
public int getLimit()
        Gets the failure tolerance limit for the DefaultFailureInterpreter that comes with a CircuitBreaker by default.
        Returns:
        the number of tolerated failures in a window
        See Also:
        DefaultFailureInterpreter

public void setLimit(int limit)

      • getTripExceptionAsString

        @ManagedAttribute
public String getTripExceptionAsString()
        returns a String representation of the breaker's last known exception that caused it to OPEN (i.e. when the breaker opens, it will record the specific exception that caused it to open)
        Overrides:
        getTripExceptionAsString in class CircuitBreaker
        Returns:
        String which is the full stack trace.

      • setDisabled

        public void setDisabled(boolean b)
        Specifies whether the associated CircuitBreaker should be tripped at startup time.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the CircuitBreaker should start open (tripped); false if the CircuitBreaker should start closed (not tripped).
